sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft to Participate in November and December Conferences
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR), a developer of hybrid eVTOL aircraft, announced its participation in several conferences in November and December 2025. This includes the Helicopter Association Canada Annual Conference, Corporate Jet Investor – Miami, MINERVA, and OAC’s Aerospace Unplugged & AGM, where management will engage in meetings and discussions. The company is focused on the testing and certification of its Cavorite X7 eVTOL.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft to Participate in November and December Conferences
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) announced its participation in multiple conferences during November and December 2025. These events include the Helicopter Association Canada Annual Conference, Corporate Jet Investor – Miami, MINERVA, and OAC’s Aerospace Unplugged & AGM. The company's management will be available for meetings and discussions to highlight their advanced hybrid eVTOL aircraft development.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Awarded INSAT Grant to Help Fund $10.5 Million All-Weather eVTOL Project
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft, a developer of hybrid eVTOL aircraft, has received a non-dilutive grant from the INSAT program to support "CRYSTAL," a $10.5 million all-weather eVTOL project. This initiative, in partnership with Flight Centre of Excellence and the University of Toronto, aims to develop a vertical propulsion system capable of operating in icy conditions, a limitation for most helicopters. The Cavorite X7, Horizon Aircraft's eVTOL, is projected to be safer, faster, more economical, and environmentally friendly, with the potential to significantly reduce CO2e emissions if it replaces a portion of the global helicopter fleet.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Selects Pratt & Whitney Canada’s PT6A Engine for Hybrid eVTOL
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft has selected Pratt & Whitney Canada's PT6A engine for its Cavorite X7 hybrid eVTOL aircraft, marking a significant step towards production. This engine choice aims to deliver superior speed, range, and efficiency compared to electric-only eVTOLs and helicopters, while also reducing hydrocarbon emissions. The partnership strengthens Canada's position in the advanced air mobility industry and highlights the Cavorite X7's unique hybrid design for military, emergency, and commercial operations in various environments.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Selects Pratt & Whitney Canada’s PT6A Engine for Hybrid eVTOL
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft has chosen Pratt & Whitney Canada's PT6A engine for its Cavorite X7 hybrid eVTOL aircraft, marking a significant step towards producing an efficient and long-range hybrid eVTOL. The PT6A's proven reliability and performance will enable the Cavorite X7 to address military, emergency, and commercial operations without relying on extensive battery charging infrastructure, offering superior speed, range, and efficiency while reducing emissions. This partnership strengthens Canada's position in the advanced air mobility industry and highlights the Cavorite X7's unique hybrid design advantage.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Partners with Motion Applied to Advance Hybrid eVTOL’s Power System
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft has partnered with Motion Applied, a former McLaren Group high-performance technology arm, to develop the motor drive inverter for its Cavorite X7 hybrid-electric VTOL aircraft. This collaboration aims to enhance power efficiency and reduce weight for the aircraft's vertical lift system. Motion Applied's expertise in design, manufacturing, and testing will support Horizon Aircraft through the prototype building and certification process, utilizing a custom air-cooled silicon carbide motor drive inverter based on Motion Applied’s MCU-X platform.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Provides Business Update and First Quarter of Fiscal 2026 Results
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR) announced its first quarter fiscal 2026 results, highlighting significant progress on its full-scale hybrid eVTOL aircraft, the Cavorite X7. The company has achieved technical milestones towards readiness for initial testing within 18 months and maintains strong liquidity with over 18 months of working capital. Horizon Aircraft is focused on developing full-scale power and aerodynamic systems, strategic partnerships, and supply chain expansion in the current quarter.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Provides Business Update and First Quarter of Fiscal 2026 Results
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft announced its first-quarter fiscal 2026 results, highlighting significant progress on its full-scale hybrid eVTOL, the Cavorite X7, with initial testing targeted for within 18 months. The company has achieved technical milestones, maintains strong liquidity, and continues to attract world-class talent. Horizon Aircraft's CEO, Brandon Robinson, expressed confidence in their development progress and focus on power and aerodynamic systems in the upcoming quarter.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Provides Business Update and First Quarter of Fiscal 2026 Results
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR) announced its first quarter fiscal 2026 results, highlighting significant progress in the development of its Cavorite X7 eVTOL aircraft. Key achievements include the construction of a full-scale prototype intended for testing within 18 months, successful completion of platform-level architecture, and fabricated main wing propulsion units. The company maintains strong liquidity and is focused on developing full-scale power and aerodynamic systems in the next quarter.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Partners with Motion Applied to Advance Hybrid eVTOL's Power System - FDL Reporter | The Reporter
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft has partnered with Motion Applied, a former high-performance technology arm of Formula 1's McLaren Group, to develop a customized motor drive inverter for its Cavorite X7 hybrid-electric VTOL aircraft. This collaboration aims to enhance power efficiency and reduce weight in the aircraft's vertical lift system, leveraging Motion Applied's expertise in electrification and power electronics. The partnership is critical for advancing the Cavorite X7 towards its full-scale prototype and certification, ensuring high performance standards for the eVTOL.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Partners with Motion Applied to Advance Hybrid eVTOL’s Power System
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft, developer of the Cavorite X7 hybrid-electric VTOL, has partnered with Motion Applied, a former McLaren Group entity specializing in electric vehicle equipment. Motion Applied will design and manufacture a customized motor drive inverter for the Cavorite X7, enhancing power efficiency and reducing weight crucial for the aircraft's vertical lift system. This collaboration aims to leverage Motion Applied's expertise to advance the Cavorite X7 towards its full-scale prototype and certification.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Partners with Motion Applied to Advance Hybrid eVTOL’s Power System

The partnership is critical for advancing the Cavorite X7's development, including building a full-scale prototype and progressing towards aircraft certification.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Partners with Motion Applied to Advance Hybrid eVTOL’s Power System
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR), a developer of hybrid-electric VTOL aircraft, has partnered with Motion Applied, a high-performance technology company, to advance the power system of its Cavorite X7 eVTOL. Motion Applied will design and manufacture a customized motor drive inverter, leveraging its expertise to improve power efficiency and reduce weight for the aircraft's vertical lift system. This collaboration aims to support Horizon Aircraft in building its full-scale prototype and progressing its aircraft certification program.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR) and Motion Applied target lighter eVTOL power
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR) has partnered with Motion Applied to develop a custom, lightweight motor drive inverter for its hybrid-electric VTOL Cavorite X7. This inverter, weighing under 3kg and utilizing silicon carbide technology, aims to enhance power efficiency, reduce cooling needs, and improve power density and range. The collaboration supports Horizon Aircraft's progress toward building a full-scale prototype and achieving aircraft certification.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Partners with Motion Applied to Advance Hybrid eVTOL’s Power System
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft, developer of the Cavorite X7 hybrid-electric VTOL aircraft, has partnered with Motion Applied, a former high-performance technology arm of McLaren Group. Motion Applied will design and manufacture a customized motor drive inverter for the Cavorite X7, aiming for higher power efficiency and reduced weight in the aircraft's vertical lift system. This collaboration will support Horizon Aircraft in building its full-scale prototype and advancing its certification program.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Partners with Motion Applied to Advance Hybrid eVTOL’s Power System
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR) has partnered with Motion Applied, a former McLaren Group high-performance technology arm, to develop the motor drive inverter for its Cavorite X7 hybrid-electric VTOL aircraft. This collaboration aims to enhance power efficiency, reduce weight, and support the aircraft's certification process by leveraging Motion Applied's expertise in design, manufacturing, and testing. The partnership will integrate a custom air-cooled silicon carbide motor drive inverter, based on Motion Applied's MCU-X platform, into the Cavorite X7 to significantly improve efficiency, power density, and range.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Partners with Motion Applied to Advance Hybrid eVTOL’s Power System
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR) has partnered with Motion Applied, a former McLaren Group high-performance technology arm, to develop a customized motor drive inverter for its Cavorite X7 hybrid-electric VTOL aircraft. feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Welcomes Esteemed Test Pilot-Astronaut Jameel Janjua to its Board of Directors
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR) has announced that test pilot-astronaut Jameel Janjua has joined its Board of Directors. Janjua brings extensive experience in experimental test flight, military operations, aerospace engineering, and business growth, having previously served as a fighter pilot and instructor, and currently as a test pilot for Virgin Galactic. His expertise is expected to be invaluable as Horizon Aircraft develops its Cavorite X7 hybrid electric VTOL aircraft and moves towards certification.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ: HOVR) briefs RCAF on Cavorite X7 hybrid eVTOL for Defence
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft hosted Brigadier General Brendan Cook of the RCAF to brief about its Cavorite X7 hybrid eVTOL aircraft. The briefing focused on the X7’s potential defense applications, including contested logistics, MEDEVAC, and surveillance, and highlighted opportunities for Canadian innovation in aerospace for defense. The visit signals growing interest in Canadian aerospace innovation for defense applications and potential NATO collaboration.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Awarded INSAT Grant to Help Fund $10.5 Million All-Weather eVTOL Project
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft has secured a prestigious INSAT grant to co-fund "CRYSTAL," a $10.5 million all-weather eVTOL project. This initiative, in partnership with Flight Centre of Excellence and the University of Toronto, aims to develop a propulsion system for severe weather conditions, which could revolutionize air travel by providing a safer, more economical, and sustainable alternative to helicopters. Horizon Aircraft will receive $2.0 million from the grant for this project, which seeks to reduce carbon emissions and operational costs significantly.

feed.title: New Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) CEO Sells $184,000.00 in Stock - MarketBeat
feed.summary: New Horizon Aircraft CEO Brian Frederick Merker sold 46,000 shares of company stock for $184,000, reducing his holdings by 14.78%. The company recently missed analyst earnings estimates, reporting a quarterly loss of ($0.11) earnings per share against an estimated ($0.08). Despite this, analysts maintain a consensus target price of $11.00 with ratings from "Strong Buy" to "Hold."

feed.title: New Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) CEO Eric Brandon Robinson Sells 140,000 Shares - MarketBeat
feed.summary: New Horizon Aircraft CEO Eric Brandon Robinson sold 140,000 shares of HOVR stock at an average price of $3.84, reducing his position by 8.68%. Following this, he still owns 1,472,510 shares valued at approximately $5.65 million. The company's stock currently trades at $3.12, and it recently reported a quarterly loss of $0.11 per share.

feed.title: New Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) Rating Increased to Strong-Buy at D Boral Capital - MarketBeat
feed.summary: D Boral Capital upgraded New Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) to a "strong-buy" rating. The company's stock experienced a 7.4% decline, opening at $3.62, and reported an EPS of ($0.11), missing consensus estimates. Insider selling and institutional investor activity have also been noted.

feed.title: Will HOVR’s Industry Spotlight Offset Widening Losses and Shift Its Aviation Narrative? - simplywall.st
feed.summary: New Horizon Aircraft Ltd. (HOVR) reported significantly widening net losses in its Q1 2025 earnings, raising concerns about its going concern status and funding. Despite high-profile appearances at aviation conferences to boost visibility, the company faces short-term risks related to capital constraints and the need to convert technological progress into sales. Investor sentiment is varied, with fair value estimates showing a wide range, reflecting ongoing uncertainties about its financial future and true valuation.

feed.title: Comparing L3Harris Technologies (NYSE:LHX) & New Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) - Defense World
feed.summary: This article compares L3Harris Technologies (LHX) and New Horizon Aircraft (HOVR) across several financial metrics and analyst ratings. L3Harris Technologies generally shows stronger profitability, revenue, and earnings, while New Horizon Aircraft is more volatile but has a higher potential upside according to analysts. The comparison covers profitability, analyst ratings, volatility, institutional and insider ownership, and earnings and valuation.

feed.title: HOVR Analyst Upgrade: New Target Price Announced at $11 | HOVR Stock News
feed.summary: D. Boral Capital analyst Jason Kolbert has upgraded New Horizon Aircraft (HOVR) with a new price target of $11, maintaining a "Buy" rating. This significantly increases the previous price targets of $2 set by Jesse Sobelson in earlier months. The report highlights the company's focus on hybrid electric vertical take-off and landing aircraft for regional air mobility.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft Selects Pratt & Whitney Canada’s PT6A Engine for Hybrid eVTOL - Winter Haven News Chief
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft has selected Pratt & Whitney Canada's PT6A engine for its Cavorite X7 hybrid eVTOL aircraft, marking a significant step towards producing a fast, long-range, and efficient hybrid eVTOL. The PT6A engine, known for its reliability and performance, will enable the Cavorite X7 to operate without reliance on battery charging infrastructure, offering advantages for military, emergency, and commercial operations. This collaboration between two Canadian entities strengthens Horizon Aircraft's position in the advanced air mobility industry globally.
